entities.name: ron
entities.description: Ron is described as a person who has been affected by the journey and is feeling fearful. He is mentioned as being placed on a bunk bed by Harry, and later breaks the silence to ask about the Cattermoles.

entities.name: hermione
entities.description: Hermione is described as a person who is making tea for Ron and trying to comfort him. She is mentioned as having a hot mug and clutching it for comfort.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is described as a person who has found the hot drink of tea to be welcome, and is trying to comfort Ron. He is mentioned as placing Ron on a bunk bed.

entities.name: cattermoles
entities.description: The Cattermoles are described as a family who may have been affected by the events of the story. Hermione mentions that they may have transported themselves away from danger using Side-Along-Apparition.

entities.name: mad-eye
entities.description: Mad-Eye is mentioned as a person who had died, and whose death was marked by the consumption of firewhisky.

relationships.description: Harry is described as trying to comfort Ron, and placing him on a bunk bed. This suggests that Harry has a caring relationship with Ron.
Hermione is described as trying to comfort Ron, and making tea for him. This suggests that Hermione has a caring relationship with Ron.
Harry is mentioned as having consumed firewhisky on the night of Mad-Eye's death. This suggests that Harry knew Mad-Eye.
